timeseries_qmc.models

class timeseries_qmc.models.HeisenbergBonded(L: int, bonds_lists: list[list[list]], z_list: list[list], z_first: bool = False)

Bases: Model

Class for handling Trotterized time evolution of a general Heisenberg model. Tortterization is done by seperating terms into mutally-exclusive sets of bonds. For an alternative Trotterization, see HeisenbergXYZ.

Note

The Trotterization of this model conserves the total Sz symmetry when Jx=Jy.

Parameters:

  • L (int) – Number of spins.

  • bonds_lists (list) – List of lists of lists specifying the interaction part of the hamiltonian. Each sublist represents a set of mutally-exclusive set of bonds. The first element of each sub-sublist is a float representing the coupling strength Jx. The second element is a float representing the coupling strength Jy. The third element is a float representing the coupling strength Jz. The last two elements are integers representing the interacting sites.

  • z_list (list) – List of lists specifying the Z part of the hamiltonian. The first element of each list is a float representing the strength of magnatic field. The other element is an integer representing the site.

  • z_first (bool, optional) – Specifies whether the Z parts should be applied first in Trotterization. Default value is ‘False’.

append_gates(qc: Circuit, term: int, t: float, n_controls: int) → None

Inherited method. See Model.append_gates().

classmethod from_coupling_list(L: int, coupling_list: list[list], Jxx: float, Jyy: float, Jzz: float, hz: float, z_first: bool = False)

Shortcut method for creating an instance from a coupling list.

Parameters:

  • L (int) – Number of spins.

  • coupling_list (list) – List of lists specifying the lattice bonds. Each list has two integers representing the sites of the bond.

  • Jxx (float) – Coupling strength in X direction.

  • Jyy (float) – Coupling strength in Y direction.

  • Jzz (float) – Coupling strength in Z direction.

  • hz (float) – Strength of magnatic field in Z direction.

  • z_first (bool, optional) – Specifies whether the Z parts should be applied first in Trotterization. Default value is ‘False’.

Returns:

model – Heisneberg model with the specified bonds and parameters.

Return type:

HeisenbergBonded

classmethod from_lattice(lattice: Lattice, Jxx: float, Jyy: float, Jzz: float, hz: float, z_first: bool = False)

Shortcut method for creating an instance from a lattice.

Parameters:

  • lattice (tenpy.models.lattice.Lattice) – List of lists specifying the lattice bonds. Each list has two integers representing the sites of the bond.

  • Jxx (float) – Coupling strength in X direction.

  • Jyy (float) – Coupling strength in Y direction.

  • Jzz (float) – Coupling strength in Z direction.

  • hz (float) – Strength of magnatic field in Z direction.

  • z_first (bool, optional) – Specifies whether the Z parts should be applied first in Trotterization. Default value is ‘False’.

Returns:

model – Heisneberg model with the specified bonds and parameters.

Return type:

HeisenbergBonded

class timeseries_qmc.models.HeisenbergXYZ(L: int, xx_list: list[list], yy_list: list[list], zz_list: list[list], z_list: list[list], order: str = 'xyz')

Bases: Model

Class for handling Trotterized time evolution of a general Heisenberg model. Tortterization is done by seperating X, Y and Z terms giving in total 3 Trotter terms. For an alternative Trotterization, see HeisenbergBonded.

Warning

The Trotterization of this model does not conserve the total Sz symmetry even when Jx=Jy. In that case, use HeisenbergBonded model instead.

Parameters:

  • L (int) – Number of spins

  • xx_list (list) – List of lists specifying the XX interaction part of the hamiltonian. The first element of each list is a float representing the coupling strength. The other two elements are integers representing the interacting sites.

  • yy_list (list) – List of lists specifying the YY interaction part of the hamiltonian. The first element of each list is a float representing the coupling strength. The other two elements are integers representing the interacting sites.

  • zz_list (list) – List of lists specifying the ZZ interaction part of the hamiltonian. The first element of each list is a float representing the coupling strength. The other two elements are integers representing the interacting sites.

  • z_list (list) – List of lists specifying the Z part of the hamiltonian. The first element of each list is a float representing the strength of magnatic field. The other element is an integer representing the site.

  • order (str, optional) – Specifies whether the X or Y or Z parts should be applied first in Trotterization. Value can be any permutation of the string ‘xyz’. Default value is ‘xyz’.

append_gates(qc: Circuit, term: int, t: float, n_controls: int) → None

Inherited method. See Model.append_gates().

classmethod from_coupling_list(L: int, coupling_list: list[list], Jxx: float, Jyy: float, Jzz: float, hz: float, order: str = 'xyz')

Shortcut method for creating an instance from a coupling list.

Parameters:

  • L (int) – Number of spins.

  • coupling_list (list) – List of lists specifying the lattice bonds. Each list has two integers representing the sites of the bond.

  • Jxx (float) – Coupling strength in X direction.

  • Jyy (float) – Coupling strength in Y direction.

  • Jzz (float) – Coupling strength in Z direction.

  • hz (float) – Strength of magnatic field in Z direction.

  • order (str, optional) – Specifies whether the X or Y or Z parts should be applied first in Trotterization. Value can be any permutation of the string ‘xyz’. Default value is ‘xyz’.

Returns:

model – Heisneberg model with the specified bonds and parameters.

Return type:

HeisenbergXYZ

  • Jzz (float) – Coupling strength in Z direction.

  • hz (float) – Strength of magnatic field in Z direction.

  • order (str, optional) – Specifies whether the X or Y or Z parts should be applied first in Trotterization. Value can be any permutation of the string ‘xyz’. Default value is ‘xyz’.

class timeseries_qmc.models.Ising(L: int, zz_list: list[list], x_list: list[list], which_first: str = 'zz')

Bases: Model

Class for obtaining quantum circuit Trotterized time evolution of a Transferse-field Ising model.

Parameters:

  • L (int) – Number of spins

  • zz_list (list) – List of lists specifying the ZZ interaction part of the hamiltonian. The first element of each list is a float representing the coupling strength. The other two elements are integers representing the interacting sites.

  • x_list (list) – List of lists specifying the X part of the hamiltonian. The first element of each list is a float representing the strength of magnatic field. The other element is an integer representing the site.

  • which_first (str, optional) – Specifies whether the ZZ part or the X part should be applied first in Trotterization. Value can be either ‘zz’ or ‘x’. Default value is ‘zz’.

append_gates(qc: Circuit, term: int, t: float, n_controls: int) → None

Inherited method. See Model.append_gates().

classmethod from_coupling_list(L: int, coupling_list: list[list], Jzz: float, hx: float, which_first: str = 'zz')

Shortcut method for creating an instance from a coupling list.

Parameters:

  • L (int) – Number of spins.

  • coupling_list (list) – List of lists specifying the lattice bonds. Each list has two integers representing the sites of the bond.

  • Jzz (float) – Coupling strength in Z direction.

  • hx (float) – Strength of magnatic field in X direction.

  • which_first (str, optional) – Specifies whether the ZZ part or the X part should be applied first in Trotterization. Value can be either ‘zz’ or ‘x’. Default value is ‘zz’.

Returns:

model – Ising model with the specified bonds and parameters.

Return type:

Ising

  • which_first (str, optional) – Specifies whether the ZZ part or the X part should be applied first in Trotterization. Value can be either ‘zz’ or ‘x’. Default value is ‘zz’.

class timeseries_qmc.models.Model

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class representing a Trotterized model Hamiltonian. It can be used to obtian its quantum circuits, Quspin operators and other properites.

abstract append_gates(qc: Circuit, term: int, t: float, n_controls: int) → None

Append gates that implements the time evolution according to specified term of the Hamiltonian.

Parameters:

  • qc (pytket.Circuit) – Circuit to append the gates to.

  • term (int) – Index of the Hamiltonian term.

  • t (float) – Time to evolve.

  • n_controls (int) – The number of ancillary control qbits in the circuit. If greater than zero, a controlled verison of gates are appended. The method is free to distribuit the control on these qbits to maximize parallel excuation. The control qbits are assumed to be the first qbits in the circuit.

calc_boltzmann_weight(psi: ndarray, beta: float) → tuple[float, float, float]

Calculate the Boltzmann weight of a state and its local energy moments at the specified invserse temperature.

Parameters:

  • psi (numpy.ndarray) – State vector \(|\psi\rangle\).

  • beta (float) – Inverse temperature \(\beta\).

Returns:

  • w (float) – Boltzmann weight \(\langle\psi| e^{-\beta H}|\psi \rangle\).

  • e (float) – Local value of energy \({\langle\psi| e^{-\beta H} H |\psi \rangle}/ {\langle\psi| e^{\beta H}|\psi \rangle}\).

  • e_sq (float) – Local value of energy’s second moment \({\langle\psi| e^{-\beta H} H^2 |\psi \rangle}/ {\langle\psi| e^{\beta H}|\psi \rangle}\).

calc_energy_mean(psi: ndarray) → float

Calculate the energy expectation value for the specified state.

Parameters:

psi (numpy.ndarray) – State vector \(|\psi\rangle\).

Returns:

result – Energy expectation value \(\langle\psi| H |\psi \rangle\).

Return type:

float

calc_energy_moment(psi: ndarray, n: int) → float

Calculate the expectation value of the n-th power of the Hamiltonian for the specified state.

Parameters:

  • psi (numpy.ndarray) – State vector \(|\psi\rangle\).

  • n (int) – power of the Hamiltonian \(n\).

Returns:

result – Expectation value \(\langle\psi| H^n |\psi \rangle\).

Return type:

float

calc_energy_variance(psi: ndarray) → float

Calculate the energy variance for the specified state.

Parameters:

psi (numpy.ndarray) – State vector \(|\psi\rangle\).

Returns:

result – Energy variance \(\langle\psi| H^2 |\psi \rangle - \langle\psi| H |\psi \rangle^2\).

Return type:

float

calc_thermal_observables(beta: float) → tuple[float, float, float]

Calculates the magnetizaiton squared and the first two moments of energy at a finite temperature.

Warning

This performes an exact diagonalization of the full hamiltonain, so it should be used only for small system sizes.

Parameters:

beta (float) – Inverse temperature \(\beta\).

Returns:

  • M2 (float) – Magnetization squared: \(\operatorname{Tr} \left[e^{-\beta H} (\sum_i Z_i)^2\right]/ \operatorname{Tr} \left[e^{-\beta H}\right]\).

  • E (flaot) – Energy: \(\operatorname{Tr} \left[e^{-\beta H} H\right]/ \operatorname{Tr} \left[e^{-\beta H}\right]\).

  • E2 (float) – Energy squared: \(\operatorname{Tr} \left[e^{-\beta H} H^2\right]/ \operatorname{Tr} \left[e^{-\beta H}\right]\).

evolve_state_1st_trotter(psi: ndarray, t: float, n_steps: int) → ndarray

Apply the 1st-order Trotterized time evolution of the model on a state and return the evolved state.

Parameters:

  • psi (numpy.ndarray) – State vector \(|\psi\rangle\).

  • t (float) – Time to evolve \(t\).

  • n_steps (int) – Number of Trotter steps \(n\).

Returns:

psi_t – Evolved state vector \(U_1^n(t)|\psi\rangle\), where \(U_1(t) := e^{-i A t/n}e^{-i B t/n}\dots e^{-i D t/n}\) is first-order Trotterization of Hamiltonain with non-commuting terms \(A, B, \dots, D\).

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

evolve_state_2nd_trotter(psi: ndarray, t: float, n_steps: int) → ndarray

Apply the 2nd-order Trotterized time evolution of the model on a state and return the evolved state.

Parameters:

  • psi (numpy.ndarray) – State vector \(|\psi\rangle\).

  • t (float) – Time to evolve \(t\).

  • n_steps (int) – Number of Trotter steps \(n\).

Returns:

psi_t – Evolved state vector \(U_2^n(t)|\psi\rangle\), where \(U_2(t) := e^{-i A t/(2n)}e^{-i B t/(2n)}\dots e^{-i D t/n}\dots e^{-i B t/(2n)}e^{-i A t/(2n)}\) is second-order Trotterization of Hamiltonain with non-commuting terms \(A, B, \dots, D\).

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

evolve_state_exact(psi: ndarray, t: float) → ndarray

Apply the exact time evolution of the model on a state and return the evolved state.

Parameters:

  • psi (numpy.ndarray) – State vector \(|\psi\rangle\).

  • t (float) – Time to evolve \(t\).

Returns:

psi_t – Evolved state vector \(e^{-iHt} |\psi\rangle\)

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

make_1st_trotter_circuit(n_steps: int, dt: float, n_controls: int = 0) → Circuit

Return a pytket circuit that implements the 1st-order Trotterized time evolution of the model.

Parameters:

  • n_steps (int) – Number of Trotter steps \(n\).

  • dt (float) – Trotter step size \(\delta t\).

  • n_controls (int) – The number of ancillary control qbits in the circuit. If greater than zero, return the circuit with an extra qbits for controlling the gates. The method is free to distribuit the control on these qbits to maximize parallel excuation.The control qbits are assumed to be the first qbits in the circuit.

Returns:

circuit – Circuit implementing first-order Trotterization \(\left[e^{-i D \delta t} \dots e^{-i B \delta t} e^{-i A \delta t}\right]^n\) where \(A, B, \dots, D\) are non-commuting terms of the Hamiltonain.

Return type:

pytket.Circuit

make_2nd_trotter_circuit(n_steps: int, dt: float, n_controls: int = 0) → Circuit

Return a pytket circuit that implements the 2nd-order Trotterized time evolution of the model.

Parameters:

  • n_steps (int) – Number of Trotter steps \(n\).

  • dt (float) – Trotter step size \(\delta t\).

  • n_controls (int) – The number of ancillary control qbits in the circuit. If greater than zero, return the circuit with an extra qbits for controlling the gates. The method is free to distribuit the control on these qbits to maximize parallel excuation. The control qbits are assumed to be the first qbits in the circuit.

Returns:

circuit – Circuit implementing second-order Trotterization \(\left[e^{-i A \delta t/2}e^{-i B \delta t/2}\dots e^{-i D \delta t}\dots e^{-i B \delta t/2}e^{-i A \delta t/2}\right]^n\) where \(A, B, \dots, D\) are non-commuting terms of the Hamiltonain.

Return type:

pytket.Circuit

make_amplitude_circuit(psi_circuit: Circuit, t: float, n_steps: int, trotter_order: int = 2) → Circuit

Return a pytket circuit that calculates the squared amplitude of Loschmidt echo for the specified state.

Parameters:

  • psi_circuit (pytket.Circuit) – Circuit for transforming the \(|0\dots0\rangle\) state into \(|\psi\rangle\).

  • t (float) – Time to evolve \(t\).

  • n_steps (int) – Number of Trotter steps \(n\).

  • trotter_order (int) – The order of Tortterization \(p\). Currently, only 1st and 2nd orders are supported.

Returns:

circuit – Amplitude circuit for measuring \(|\langle\psi| e^{-i t E} U_p^n(t) |\psi\rangle|^2\) where \(U_1(t) := e^{-i D t/n}\dots e^{-i B t/n}e^{-i A t/n}\) is first-order Trotterization, \(U_2(t) := e^{-i A t/(2n)}e^{-i B t/(2n)}\dots e^{-i D t/n}\dots e^{-i B t/(2n)}e^{-i A t/(2n)}\) is second-order Trotterization and \(A, B, \dots, D\) are non-commuting terms of the Hamiltonain.

Return type:

pytket.Circuit

make_cat_circuit(psi_bitstring: list | ndarray, t: float, n_steps: int, trotter_order: int = 2, imaginary: bool = False, energy_shift=0, log_preperation=True) → Circuit
Return a pytket circuit that implements the catstate trick for calculating Loschmidt echo for the specified

state.

Warning

This method assumes that the state \(|0\dots0\rangle\) is an eigenstate of the model. Otherwise, the results are unpredictable.

Parameters:

  • psi_bitstring (list or numpy.ndarray) – List/array of zeros and ones representing some product state \(|\psi\rangle\).

  • t (float) – Time to evolve \(t\).

  • n_steps (int) – Number of Trotter steps \(n\).

  • trotter_order (int) – The order of Tortterization \(p\). Currently, only 1st and 2nd orders are supported.

  • imaginary (bool) – If ‘True’, return the circuit measuring the imaginary part of Loschmidt echo. Otherwise, return the circuit for the real part.

  • energy_shift (float) – Value to be used for shifting the zero energy of the Hamiltonian \(E\). Default value is zero.

  • log_preperation (bool) – Whether to use a circuit of logarithmic depth for prepering the cat state. Deafult value is true (recommended).

Returns:

circuit – Catstate circuit for measuring the real or imaginary part of \(\langle\psi| e^{-i t E} U_p^n(t) |\psi\rangle\) where \(U_1(t) := e^{-i D t/n}\dots e^{-i B t/n}e^{-i A t/n}\) is first-order Trotterization, \(U_2(t) := e^{-i A t/(2n)}e^{-i B t/(2n)}\dots e^{-i D t/n}\dots e^{-i B t/(2n)}e^{-i A t/(2n)}\) is second-order Trotterization and \(A, B, \dots, D\) are non-commuting terms of the Hamiltonain.

Return type:

pytket.Circuit

make_hadamard_circuit(psi_circuit: Circuit, t: float, n_steps: int, trotter_order: int = 2, split: bool = True, use_optimized_control: bool = True, n_controls: int = 1, imaginary: bool = False, energy_shift=0) → Circuit

Return a pytket circuit that implements the Hadamard test using specified Trotterization of H.

Parameters:

  • psi_circuit (pytket.Circuit) – Circuit for transforming the \(|0\dots0\rangle\) state into \(|\psi\rangle\).

  • t (float) – Time to evolve \(t\).

  • n_steps (int) – Number of Trotter steps \(n\).

  • trotter_order (int) – The order of Tortterization:math:p. Currently, only 1st and 2nd orders are supported.

  • split (bool) – Whether to split 2nd-order Trotter cicuit or not. See make_split_2nd_trotter_circuits() for details. This paramter is ignored for 1st-order circuits.

  • use_optimized_control (bool) – Whether to use manually-optimized controlled gates or rely on pytket QControlBox.

  • n_controls (int) – The number of ancillary control qbits in the circuit. Using more than one control qbit has the potential of speed-up by parallelizing excution of controlled gates. If ‘use_optimized_control’ is False, this value is ignored and only one control qbit is used. The control qbits are the first qbits in the circuit.

  • imaginary (bool) – If ‘True’, return the circuit measuring the imaginary part of Loschmidt echo. Otherwise, return the circuit for the real part.

  • energy_shift (float) – Value to be used for shifting the zero energy of the Hamiltonian \(E\). Default value is zero.

Returns:

circuit – Hadmard circuit for measuring the real or imaginary part of \(\langle\psi| e^{-i t E} U_p^n(t) |\psi\rangle\) where \(U_1(t) := e^{-i D t/n}\dots e^{-i B t/n}e^{-i A t/n}\) is first-order Trotterization, \(U_2(t) := e^{-i A t/(2n)}e^{-i B t/(2n)}\dots e^{-i D t/n}\dots e^{-i B t/(2n)}e^{-i A t/(2n)}\) is second-order Trotterization and \(A, B, \dots, D\) are non-commuting terms of the Hamiltonain.

Return type:

pytket.Circuit

make_split_2nd_trotter_circuits(n_steps: int, dt: float, n_controls: int = 0) → tuple[pytket._tket.circuit.Circuit, pytket._tket.circuit.Circuit]

Return pytket circuits that implements the splitted 2nd-order Trotterized time evolution of the model.

Example A second-order Trotterization \([e^{-i A \delta t/2} e^{-i B \delta t} e^{-i A \delta t/2}]^n\) can written as \(e^{i A \delta t/2} [e^{-i A \delta t} e^{-i B \delta t}]^n e^{-i A \delta t/2}\). This splitting is useful because it allows performing the Hadamard test by controlling only the circuit of \([e^{-i A \delta t} e^{-i B \delta t}]^n\) while considering the circuit of \(e^{-i A \delta t/2}\) as part of state preperation.

Parameters:

  • n_steps (int) – Number of Trotter steps \(n\).

  • dt (float) – Trotter step size \(\delta t\).

  • n_controls (int) – The number of ancillary control qbits in the circuit. If greater than zero, return the circuit with an extra qbits for controlling the gates. The method is free to distribuit the control on these qbits to maximize parallel excuation. The control qbits are assumed to be the first qbits in the circuit.

Returns:

  • main_circuit (pytket.Circuit) – Circuit implementing the Trotterization \(\left[e^{-i C \delta t/2} \dots e^{-i B \delta t/2} e^{-i A \delta t} e^{-i B \delta t/2} \dots e^{-i C \delta t/2} e^{-i D \delta} \right]^n\) where \(A, B, \dots, C, D\) are non-commuting terms of the Hamiltonain.

  • residue_circuit (pytket.Circuit) – Circuit implementing the Trotterization \(\left[e^{-i C \delta t/2} \dots e^{-i B \delta t/2} e^{-i A \delta t/2} \right]\).

abstract property n_qbits: int

Number of qubits necessary for representing a state of this model.

abstract property n_terms: int

Number of non-commutative terms in the Hamilatonian.
